inlineContent.text: Verge is designed for use from small and supports to scale. Setting Verge up quickly, and tune-up when we need it.
Does flux have a good performance?The performance will be the worst depends on how it is used.Verge automatically tune-up and shows us how we could gain a performant.
Verge supports both of UI framework. Especially, it highly supports to update partially UI on UIKit.

content.text: Verge supports small start and scaling up

inlineContent.text: Verge is a state management library for iOS (UIKit / SwiftUI).Mostly it‚Äôs based on Flux architecture.Flux architecture is so beautiful and simplified thinking.Although, we need to do several tuning to bring it into a real product.In fact, Flux needs to consider about computing resources.

Verge contains several ideas to do this from Web technologies such as Redux, Vuex, and Recoil.They have very useful techniques to be successful in real-world productions based on the core-concept of Flux.

Verge can be setting it up quickly, and tune performance up when we need it.Verge automatically tune-up as possible and shows us what makes performance badly while development from Xcode‚Äôs documentation.
A way to create a ViewModel
A way to create a customized store

content.text: Prepare moving to SwiftUI from now with Verge

inlineContent.text: SwiftUI‚Äôs concept is similar to the concept of React, Vue, and Elm.Therefore, the concept of state management will become to be similar as well.
That is Redux or Vuex and more.
Now, almost of iOS Applications are developed on top of UIKit.And We can‚Äôt say SwiftUI is ready for top production.However, it would change.
It‚Äôs better to use the state management that fits SwiftUI from now. It‚Äôs not only for that, current UIKit based applications can get more productivity as well.
We accept your questions about usage of Verge and something else in GitHub Issues.
